content.description: Sds on obvious blocky hold on the SE side. Work right and top out same as Crimpy Smalls
Start same as Crimpy Smalls and work into Notorious.
Pinch or crimp obvious left hand hold, right hand on low crimp. Throw yourself to the rail on the right and top out.

Taken from Travis' GMAP repo: On the North side of the boulder. Starts matched on the good rail in the corner. A big move to another rail. Avoid going left into the hollow section, instead head right on good holds.
Taken from Travis' GMAP repo: Start matched on ledge feature. Climb up to a off balance topout. Cruise the slab above to walk off at the top.

Very unique boulder problem, similar in style to https://www.mountainproject.com/route/120261048/clamor-and-filth-of-the-cultural-apparatus,

but a little harder. Figuring out the beta took a couple of months and the wit of Matt Starr, Chris Henderson, and Timothy Carlson. The FA was done with the best Beta we could come up with but I am sure there has to be an easier way to do the crux, other than the "split-one-leg muscle-up". Having at least 2 pads and one person spotting closely is a must. DO NOT ATTEMPT THIS BOULDER ON YOUR OWN!. It is very easy to get stuck and the only way to get unstuck is to have someone lift your back and help you land. Either start sitting down at the end of the cave with the right leg jammed deep inside the crack and the 2 hands on hand jams. Do a few moves to get a bomber left-hand jam at the start of the wide crack. Alternatively, you can start standing up with the left hand jammed at the start of the wide crack -- the grade is the same but is more fun to start sitting down. From here, we did not find any other way to do this other than inverting (getting both legs inside the crack with the head down)  in order to reach a bomber jam at the top end of the wide crack. Finally, get another jam at the start of the top out and find a mega jug. Use all your offwidth skills to top out.
content.location: All the way inside the cave.

content.description: Start on blocky feature. Top out slightly right.
Shade in the morning, sunny in the afternoon.
